Name: Small house with a lamp
Description: This object of terracotta, which comes from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at Herakleopolis Magna, probably constitutes a model of a house with a lamp. The piece, of cylindrical form, is provided with a rectangular opening via which one introduced a small oil lamp, and with a hole for suspension in the roof. It is possible that this type of lamp was used in a religious context.
